clinicalDescription:
Overview: Multiple Sclerosis (MS) is the most common immune-mediated inflammatory demyelinating disease of the central nervous system, characterized relapsing-remitting disease with progressive neurologic disability.
Presentation: There are no presentations that are unique to MS, but common initial presentations include sensory loss in limbs, unilateral loss of vision or facial sensations, motor weakness, double vision, bladder incontinence in a younger adult following episodic pattern.
Assessment: Brain MRI may show lesions.
Plan: Disease modifying therapy examples: Ocrelizumab, Siponimod, Rituximab.
Prognosis: Lifelong progressive disease that maybe severely debilitating associated with poor quality of life. Relapsing and remitting nature may change to secondary progressive MS with more or less continuous symptoms.
